full_product_name.product_name: haproxy-0:1.8.15-6.el8_1.1 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: haproxy: malformed HTTP/2 requests can lead to out-of-bounds writes

reference.description: bz#1819111: CVE-2020-11100 haproxy: malformed HTTP/2 requests can lead to out-of-bounds writes

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank the HAProxy project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Felix Wilhelm (Google Project Zero) as the original reporter.

note:
An update for haproxy is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The haproxy packages provide a reliable, high-performance network load balancer for TCP and HTTP-based applications.
Security Fix(es):
* haproxy: malformed HTTP/2 requests can lead to out-of-bounds writes (CVE-2020-11100)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
